entry.et: Middle English kinde, from Old English cynd; akin to Old English cynn kin

def.dt: :nature
:family lineage
:manner
:fundamental nature or quality :essence
:a group united by common traits or interests :category
:a specific or recognized variety what kind of car do you drive
:a doubtful or barely admissible member of a category a kind of gray
:goods or commodities as distinguished from money payment in kind
:the equivalent of what has been offered or received
:many likes all kinds of sports
:plenty of has all kinds of time
:affectionate loving
:of a sympathetic or helpful nature
:of a forbearing nature :gentle
:arising from or characterized by sympathy or forbearance a kind act
:of a kind to give pleasure or relief
:to a moderate degree :somewhat it's kind of late to begin
:in a way that approximates :more or less kind of sneaked up on us
:four cards of the same rank plus a wild card in one hand see poker illustration
:four cards of the same rank in one hand see poker illustration
:consisting of something (as goods or commodities) other than money in–kind relief for the poor
:three cards of the same rank in one hand see poker illustration
